H0.text: Methane is the name of the molecule which has one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H1.text: Carbohydrate is the name of the molecule that has one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H2.text: Sulfur is the name of the molecule which has one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

H3.text: Carbon monoxide is the name of the molecule which has one carbon and four hydrogen atoms.

A4.text: Methane (US: METH-ayn, UK: MEE-thayn) is a chemical compound with the chemical formula CH4 (one carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms).
